message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest depression and amitriptyline is commonly used to treat depression and fibromyalgia. Fluoxetine is also a common antidepressant but may not be as effective for fibromyalgia. Phenelzine is a monoamine oxidase inhibitor that is reserved for treatment-resistant depression due to its significant side effects. Electroconvulsive therapy is usually considered a last resort and may not be necessary in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest that the patient is suffering from depression. Among the options, amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant that is commonly used to treat depression and fibromyalgia. Fluoxetine is also an antidepressant, but it may cause weight loss as a side effect, which may not be desirable in this case. Phenelzine is a monoamine oxidase inhibitor, which has more risks and potential side effects. Electroconvulsive therapy is usually reserved for severe cases of depression that do not respond to other treatments.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is experiencing symptoms of depression, including weight loss, early morning awakening, and feelings of guilt. Among the options, amitriptyline, a tricyclic antidepressant, is commonly used to treat depression and also helps to alleviate chronic pain, such as fibromyalgia. Fluoxetine and Phenelzine are also antidepressants, but they may not be the best option for this patient given his history of fibromyalgia. Electroconvulsive therapy may be considered if other treatments fail, but it is not the first-line therapy for depression.

Fluoxetine is also a valid option, but it may worsen fibromyalgia pain. Phenelzine is a type of monoamine oxidase inhibitor and is not typically used as a first-line treatment for depression. Electroconvulsive therapy is usually reserved for severe cases of depression that are resistant to other treatments.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient shows symptoms of depression, weight loss, and guilt. Among the options provided, Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant used to treat depression, anxiety, and neuropathic pain. Fluoxetine is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor used for depression, panic disorder, and OCD. Phenelzine is a monoamine oxidase inhibitor used for depression and anxiety. Electroconvulsive therapy is a last resort and is used for severe cases of depression that are unresponsive to other treatments.

Fluoxetine is also an antidepressant but is less effective in treating fibromyalgia.
